question.name: Question A
question.stem: Which of the following examples demonstrate an infant's readiness to communicate?

foil.text: Noticing and attempting to re-create the happy expressions she sees on her mom's face.
Sleeping longer at night when soft music is playing.
Preferring to look at bright colors.
Crying when he is hungry.

question.name: Question A
question.stem: As you observe a dad reading to his 3-year-old boy, you notice that he quickly reads straight through several picture books. What advice could you offer the parent to increase the quality of their reading time?

foil.text: Ask questions like, "What do you think will happen next?" or, "Why do you think the character did that?"
Point out details in the pictures such as colors, names of objects, or the setting.
Discuss the feelings of the characters in the story and the appropriateness of how the characters deal with their emotions.
Stop reading picture books so that his child can exercise his imagination.
